sense.name: The action of opposing some other social or military force.
sense.examples: He encountered a feeling or resistance from the participants. The enemy offered little resistance. Despite resistance from the management, he went ahead.

sense.name: Any mechanical or electrical force that tends to retard or oppose.
sense.examples: The material presents much resistance. The device measures resistance.

sense.name: (medicine) the capacity of an organism to defend against disease.
sense.examples: This gene indicates resistance to the strain. These trees have resistance to smog and salt.

sense.name: A secret group organized to overthrow a government or occupation force.
sense.examples: The resistance hid here for years. The government continually battles the resistance.

sense.name: The degree of unresponsiveness of a disease-causing organism to drugs.
sense.examples: This bacteria has great resistance to penicillin. Many microoganisms now have resistance to antibiotics.

sense.name: (psychiatry) an unwillingness to bring repressed feelings into conscious awareness.
sense.examples: The patient expresses resistance and will not talk. Many subjects have initial resistance but then open up.
